voice.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the sounds that you make when you speak, or the ability to make these sounds
voice.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the quality of sound you produce when you sing
voice.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Sophie’s got a lovely singing voice
voice.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: a piece written for six voices and piano
voice.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the right or ability to express an opinion, to vote, or to influence decisions
voice.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Parents should have a voice in deciding how their children are educated.
voice.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: an opinion or wish that is expressed
voice.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The government needs to listen to the voice of middle-class Americans.
a fair, democratic society, in which individuals are able to make their voice heard (=express their opinion so that people notice it)

Senator Prior spoke out, adding her voice to the call for new laws to protect the environment.
voice.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: a person, organization, newspaper etc that expresses the opinions or wishes of a group of people
voice.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The senator is the voice of the religious right.
